descriptionPlain:
Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. lists.content:
• Experience in Supply Chain solutions and sales methodology.
  • Exceed annual sales targets
  • Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for each enterprise account, then drive the execution of that plan to success
  • Prospecting, building pipeline and selling Coupa cloud-based spend management solutions to enterprise Coupa clients
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and quarterback the deal to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
  • Provide proactive, trusted thought leadership to target accounts
  • Co-sell with Resellers and Alliance Partners as needed (Resellers and Partners are acquired and managed by the Coupa Alliances team out of Coupa headquarters in San Mateo, CA, and in locations around the globe)
  • Orchestrate client and internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that Coupa will deliver and the investments the client will need to make
  • Create and execute Field Sales Campaigns to create demand
  • Develop and deliver world-class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Implement our Coupa Sales Best Practices
  • Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%)
  • Maintain the system of record in Salesforce.com
  • Develop and deliver world class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and drive deals to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model (http://www.executiveboard.com/exbd-resources/content/challenger/index.html)
  • Align overall value messaging targeted towards the chief economic buyer in target accounts
  • Build out an account penetration model that encourages multi-angle access into key accounts

• Minimum 10+ years of direct sales experience in the software industry, in special SaaS and sale of value
  • The eligible candidate should be able to demonstrate a successful career with extensive direct sales and business development experience in the region, and should be able to provide direct references in the Region who can attest to the acclaimed experience
  • Consistent track record of achieving / exceeding sales quota (on premise and SaaS)
  • Strong executive presence – very comfortable with C-level executives, especially CFOs
  • Expertise in managing multi-stakeholder sales cycles and closing large deals
  • Ability to prospect within greenfield accounts
  • Organized and specific experience with enterprise account planning
  • Focused on selling business value to Finance and Business stakeholders using ROI and TCO models, rather than competing on “features & functions”
  • Ability to identify enterprise client pains and develop unique and compelling value propositions that focus on delivering business value to the client
  • Equally successful at engaging with all levels in an organization (bottom up & top down)
  • Assertive, Passionate, Consultative, loves to compete and win
  • Great at building relationships and working within a team-selling environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with selling SaaS solutions
  • Spend management domain expertise desired
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced and passionate environment
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience required 
  • Speaking Portuguese (native) and English.

A Principal Engineer/Architect is a hands-on, talented, innovative, and practical individual with functional experience to design, implement and support products and product components on a predictable schedule.
Capable of working under minimal direction and exercising considerable latitude, they will provide technical expertise in developing solutions to complex software engineering problems, which require frequent use of ingenuity and creativity.
Experienced in designing application-focused solutions, performing architectural analysis, and identifying issues and provide solutions for the business problems.
Sound functional knowledge of enterprise application architecture in Spend Management domain including Procurement, Sourcing, and Financial Transaction Processing.
Work in an agile environment where quick iterations and good feedback are a way of life.

lists.content:
• Lead the design and development of new reusable architecture components and major functional upgrades for the most advanced capabilities of the Coupa Application Platform.
  • Document the solutions leveraging existing standards and create new templates where required; present them to project specific governing bodies for review and approval. Consulting skills are imperative to gain consensus on solutions proposed.
  • Work with peers to sponsor the design and architectural changes with a goal of delivering value to customers at every phase of development and implementation of that design.
  • Work alongside of Development and Product Managers to review and/or create the feature designs for the major/minor releases and also participate in defect analysis for maintenance releases to ensure the robust functional resolution to the customer facing issues.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring to engineers, designers and developers.
  • Engage cross-organizational teams such as Product Management, Integrations, Services, Support and Operations, to ensure success of overall software development, implementation and deployment.

• 8+ years system implementation experience in a large IT organization with large, complex enterprise system implementations
  • 8+ years of experience developing business applications
  • 5+ years defining high level design for one or more business domains.
  • 5+ years of experience interpreting and predicting outcomes of existing business processes and current technology solutions.
  • Broad knowledge of middleware/application integration products
  • Demonstrated proficiency in understanding and executing enterprise architecture and software development life cycle methodologies

• Master’s (preferred) or bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, computer engineering, systems analysis or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
  • Extra Considerations Given To:
  • Experience in building large scale business applications
  • Experience with architecting third-party developer frameworks
  • Experience with designing for an enterprise multi-tenant system
  • Experience developing with containers, micro-services and message queues
  • Experience with refactoring and modularizing legacy applications
  • Experience designing solutions with heterogeneous technology stacks
  • Contributed and launched web application deployed on cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.)
  • Dealt with database performance issues and query optimization in MySQL

lists.content:
• Customer Success Managers represent the primary point of contact from Coupa to customers after customer go-live.  As such, they provide three critical functions: 1) Work with/coach customer teams to drive customer success strategies and to achieve customer success goals, 2) Provide communication to customers regarding Coupa, new product capabilities and other critical information, and 3) provide a consistent point of contact for customers and a “concierge” into other needed Coupa functions and resources.
  • Specific goals center on the following:
  • Customer success
  • Customer referenceability
  • Customer renewal and growth of annual contract value.
  • Customer solution expansion
  • Key activities include:
  • Participate in customer success metrics workshops
  • Develop customer success roadmap
  • Conduct scheduled customer check-ins
  • Drive periodic business reviews
  • Manage renewals
  • Monitor customer performance.
  • Manage customer relationships
  • Establish role as trusted advisor
  • “QB” Coupa internal resources as needed
  • Share best practices ideas, product information, and relevant Coupa news.
  • Support/drive customer campaigns

• Strong background in customer / client management.
  • Experience with demonstrated success in the following:
  • Managing client expectations
  • Developing and maintaining executive relationships and associated influencing strategies
  • Project management including managing disparate, cross-functional, cross-enterprise project teams
  • Ability to have value-based conversation with business executives
  • Experience in procure to pay.
  • Experience managing products, product offerings and customer experience with products
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong communication skills including professional writing skills, verbal skills and experience presenting to executive teams.
  • Background in software and SaaS solutions a plus.

In the role of Director Channel Marketing you are the channel marketing expert and based on your experiences you can grow our partner performance and partnership in EMEA and APAC.
Our global team consists of 9 Channel Marketing Specialists and you are reporting to the SVP Alliances Programs. As the owner of core campaigns, you are working with several teams in EMEA/APAC to define go-to-market strategies, marketing mix and the customer decision journey. You will work directly with Sales as well as Marketing Communications to develop, execute, and supervise launch campaigns.

The role is fully remote in DACH, UK, Ireland, France, Sweden or Dubai!

lists.content:
• Build marketing plans, including budget planning, with our key GSI and Regional System Integrator partners
  • Collaborate closely with the alliances managers for EMEA/APAC in field marketing and sales executives to develop the strategies, processes and content required to execute outstanding campaigns and programs which result in meaningful pipeline growth
  • Coordinate and work with all stakeholders and corporate marketing on digital marketing initiatives and programs for lead creation
  • Update and communicate Coupa’s content and partner marketing framework available for partners, through specific partner marketing enablement initiatives
  • Manage partner Press Releases, blogs and other digital announcements and communications with Coupa PR Team
  • Participate on partner trade shows and partner programs and create a social media partner program

• Bachelor or Master’s degree in economics, business (administration), Marketing or Sales related
  • Proven, successful inbound and outbound demand generation program creation, execution, measurement, analysis and reporting across channels
  • Advanced knowledge of current and innovation B2B demand generation methods across multiple channels (email, webinars, SEM/SEO, display, social, events, etc.)
  • Ability to think strategically to develop thought leadership campaigns, pieces.
  • Able to work comfortably in a hands-on, multi-tasking, deadline-driven environment
  • Experience in managing and working with cross functional and fast-growth teams with natural leadership skills
  • Creative thinker, strategic thinker, problem solver

lists.content:
• Define and drive Global System Integrator go-to-market plan with key strategic partners.
  • Work strategically with Coupa’s own Professional Services team to ensure that Coupa has working relationships with key Global Systems Integrators.
  • Work with Coupa marketing to create joint marketing and awareness programs with Alliance partners to drive incremental opportunities for Coupa.
  • Effectively communicate Coupa's value proposition, vision, product and service capabilities to Global System Integrators and drive this into joint customer messaging.
  • Work closely with Coupa sales management team to ensure proper engagement with partners.
  • Drive Partner opportunities as necessary, including conflict resolution.
  • Achieve and exceed assigned revenue and referral targets and other objectives.
  • Introduce Partner to new Coupa products and services as they become available.

• Fluent in Japanese
  • Bachelor’s degree with extra consideration given to candidates with a Master’s Degree, or equivalent.
  • Demonstrated minimum of 10 years of experience in partner management (spend management preferable)
  • Proven ability to develop and implement complex programs and achieve required results.
  • Knowledge of team concepts and principles; sales and marketing strategies' management of resources; analytical problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to win in highly competitive sales situations.
  • Strong executive and consultative relationship selling background.
  • Ability to travel for partner meetings and events as needed.
  • Organization – demonstrated strong program management skills and ability to manage many partners across regions at the most senior levels.
  • Communication - understand and communicate effectively with partners including using marketing tools to keep them aware of Coupa’s products and value proposition.
  • Business - know Coupa’s business and how Partner’s business works; know the competition and how to position Coupa.
  • Decision Making and Problem Solving - assess key decision makers' needs and determine, and deliver, the appropriate messages to meet Coupa partner and customer needs.
  • Initiative - expand Coupa solutions to existing Partners’ customers by identifying and creating leads through networking and marketing
  • Integrity - honest even when self-damaging - able to influence others - recognizes the need for tact - encourages ethical work environment.
  • Negotiating - proficient in managing complex negotiations - identify and address hidden agendas.

lists.text: How You Will Impact Coupa Every Day
lists.content:
• Strategic advisor to all the BU’s operating in the region which is assigned, acting as a coach and advisor to managers.
  • Demonstrates a combination of country, regional and global People Team leadership mindset
  • Has the ability to build strong relationships within the regional People Team and share learnings and experiences of their region which allows for colleague learning development opportunity
  • Coordinates with other People functions (HR Ops, Compensation, Talent Acquisition and Learning and Development) to effectively manage the successful delivery of professional HR support 
  • Understand BU and regional strategies, aligning the country People Team priorities to them while balancing regional and global People Team priorities.
  • Be the face of HR to all external bodies including regulatory authorities and government agencies within the region
  • Design, implement and execute HR initiatives, ensuring consistent implementation while standardising as much as possible across the region and global People Team.
  • As required, participate in regional/global project teams to ensure country/regional perspective is not overlooked
  • Ensure regular review of all country/regional policies and processes, drafting and implementing any which are not in place 
  • Oversight and management of all local vendors providing HR services in countries e.g. benefit providers
  • Ensure Coupa is fully compliant and up to date with local regulatory requirements and employment laws
  • Foster a climate of positive and productive employment relations
  • Drive a culture that is in line with Coupa’s core values – Strive for Excellence, Focus on Results, Ensure Customer Success.

lists.text: What You Will Bring to Coupa
lists.content:
• Bachelor’s degree or above or equivalent experience, HR related major preferred
  • MBS / MSc in HR preferred
  • HR experience in a fast paced, global technology environment
  • Strong verbal and written communication
  • Fluency in English and German
  • Strong organisational skills and ability to implement and/or improve how things are done within the team
  • A scale to grow mindset 
  • Solutions focused mindset to deliver high level support to the business
  • Continuous improvement mindset to support service to the business and reach efficiency in own team
  • Knowledge of applicable local employment laws and practices
  • Detects internal and environmental changes and can influence relevant stakeholders to respond to those changes effectively
  • Experience in working in an international environment
  • Motivational, can do attitude.

• At Coupa, we have 3 core values and the competencies we expect are centred around each of these -

    • 1. Ensure Customer Success
  • Customer Success
  • Problem solving
  • Build relationships 
  • Adaptability



    • 2. Focus on Results
  • Bias for action
  • Plans and prioritizes
  • Results focused
  • Team focused



    • 3. Strive for Excellence
  • Collaborator
  • Strong communicator
  • Trusted advisor

Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

The opportunity
As a Lead Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development of solutions for our Treasury platform. 

Treasury in a nutshell: To spend you need to make a payment. To make a payment you need to have enough cash at the right time, in the right account, and in the right currency. Treasury is part of Coupa Pay, a fast-growing part of the Coupa solution. 

At a business level, together with product management you will change the way our customers deal with financial challenges like having a reliable overview across all banks & accounts in one place, plan future financial needs and reconcile these with reality.

At a technical level we will jointly drive scaling our Business Spend Management platform as we expand and find the right balance between the power of a consolidated codebase and the flexibility of microservices. You will take on the responsibility of making sure we are building maintainable, extendable & performant software that scales across our customer base and equally important our engineering community. This gives you the opportunity to collaborate across products with engineers all over the company to shape central components used by many teams. 

In more detail:
- We mainly work on C#, .Net 6 in combination with a TypeScript / React frontend
- We operate as SaaS solution on AWS
- We follow design principles such as SOLID, CQRS and DDD
- We utilize modern CI/CD pipeline, featuring Kubernetes, Jenkins and Octopus
- We apply peer reviews and pair programming 
- We follow a typical release cycle where you will drive feature design, participate and guide implementation and take responsibility for delivery to the customer

At Coupa we also practice a culture of sharing, you will have various opportunities to share your ideas and hear from other teams how they solve their technical challenges. For example we regularly organize hack days in which we explore new ideas & technologies.

We are thrilled to see your ideas become reality in our products and processes.
To get more first hand impressions please check out the stories of Coupa employees in our Humans of Coupa section.

About you
We are looking for a dedicated and passionate Software Engineer, with strong contributions in current and past roles. We need someone with:
- Mastery in an object oriented language (not necessarily C#)
- Excellent knowledge of large scale web applications/distributed systems.
- Critical thinking, continuously challenging how and why we do things to help us improve
- Excellent English communication skills both verbal and in writing.
- Willingness to live our values: Ensure Customer Success, Focus on Results and Strive for Excellence
- Experience and willingness to coach & develop colleagues

Typical team members have a higher education degree in a STEM area. This is however not a hard requirement.

What can you expect when you join Coupa
During your onboarding you will:
- Have a buddy that will guide you on your onboarding journey
- Receive training on our products, processes and organization
- Learn our stack by diving into pair programming with the team

Once you are fully onboarded you will:
- Drive feature design and implementation in your team
- Participate in our community to evolve together
- Pursue your personal development journey as part of the Coupa family

Location
Coupa has a modern office in Ettenheim in the heart of the black forest. 
Our flexible policy enables you to work from home according to your and your team's needs.

descriptionPlain:
Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

Coupa’s partner program, Partner Connect, was designed to create an experienced and highly leveraged partner ecosystem that supports mutual customers working to optimize their business spend. Partners consist of consulting and implementation practices, technology providers, and resellers focused on source-to-contract, procure-to-pay, expense management, third party risk management, supply chain design, treasury management, business process optimization, change management, and supplier onboarding.

As a member of the Partner Success Team, the Partner Portfolio Analyst (PPA) will focus on supporting partner delivery in the expanding Corporate and Mid-Market customer tiers. The Partner Portfolio Analyst will support partner implementations from kick off through go-live, ensuring a successful handover to Coupa’s CVM team.  The ideal candidate will have delivery experience that enables them to engage with internal/external stakeholders, as well as industry/consulting experience pertaining to the delivery of SaaS solutions. This person should have a demonstrated ability to manage & execute at scale.  This candidate will be responsible for managing key activities, dates, audits and communication with Coupa delivery partners to support partner led delivery success.

lists.content:
• Support the primary point of contact, Partner Program Manager
  • Maintain detailed information on assigned partners’ projects through regularly reviewing project health and lifecycle stages, including
  •                        ○         Key Dates
  •                        ○         Project Lifecycle Stages
  •                        ○         Design & Customer Readiness documentation
  •                        ○         Sales to Partner & Partner to Customer Value Management handover process
  • Provide visibility of projects to internal stakeholders
  • Measure partner performance to KPIs related to Customer's product usage
  • Regular Duties include:
  •                        ○         Dashboard reporting in SFDC
  •                        ○         Engage with Partners to drive to milestones/deliverables
  •                        ○         Drive meetings/project reviews
  •                        ○         Engage Cross-functional Support as needed
  •                        ○         Periodic Partner Project Audits
  • A successful PPA Will be able to demonstrate
  • Data accuracy & completion of all deliverables
  • Consistency & compliance to the program process
  • Identification and execution of program improvements
  • Strong people management capabilities and drive to scale

• Bachelor's degree in business or a related field, with a background in channel & partner development, delivery, execution or account management.
  • 2- 4+ years of experience in SaaS delivery, working with Partners is preferred
  • Experience working in an offshore/near shore team structure
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management and interpersonal skills
  • Exceptional collaboration and relationship-building skills – with the ability to develop work in relationships at all levels of management
  • Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
  • Strong project management and analytical skills
  • Qualities that reflect a self-motivated individual with the ability to work as part of a team.
  • High intellect and business acumen, curiosity and a willingness to move fast, be wrong and improve.
  • Maintain productivity across competing priorities.
  • Self-motivated & work effectively under pressure
  • Contribute to a fast-paced, complex, collaborative, and team-oriented environment
  • Proficiency using Google Sheets or Excel
  • Must be willing to work out of our Bogota Colombia office
  • Ability to support English speaking clients
  • Ability and willingness to travel (10%)

• Experience with the Coupa platform or other BSM platforms
  • Coupa Certification a plus
  • Knowledge of Salesforce, Smartsheet, Google Docs
  • Knowledge of technology partners in procurement and adjacencies

Reporting to the Payroll Specialist - International, the Payroll Specialist is responsible for coordinating the processing for India & International payrolls and for ensuring payroll activities are performed in a timely manner with an exceptional level of quality. The Payroll Specialist is the initial point of contact for employees with payroll related questions.

lists.text: Your objectives in this role include:
lists.content:
• Oversee and assist with the Payroll processing for International payroll.
  • Audit the processing of  Payroll.
  •  Partner with the HR team to ensure payroll data flows seamlessly between HR and Payroll and ensure changes are implemented correctly across various systems.
  • Act as the system expert for Payroll.
  • Apply knowledge of country tax regulations, as well as State taxes (where applicable), wage and hour laws, and local tax requirements to ensure compliance.
  • Play a key role in new system implementations related to payroll process. Provide input on payroll processes and perform user testing.
  • Lead payroll related process improvement initiatives with cross functional partners.
  • Support month end close by providing payroll reports and explanations as needed.
  • Support various internal and external audits.
  • Maintain payroll records and follow established Company policies to ensure compliance with internal control protocols.
  • Respond to employee and manager inquiries and requests regarding payroll matters, timely, professionally and concisely.
  • Special projects and other duties as assigned, including system implementations, process improvement projects and compliance audits.

• You are detail oriented & enjoy working with numbers. You possess a strong collaborative approach and can build effective relationships with cross-functional departments to drive internal customer satisfaction and provide timely information to business owners. You seek to research and resolve issues and escalate to management as needed. You have strong organizational and communication skills and can prioritize, plan, perform and communicate activities and findings both in written and verbal form.  You seek to improve processes and aren’t afraid to voice your suggestions.

• Minimum 2-3 years of recent hands-on payroll experience at a fast growth company.
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business administration preferred.
  • Experience managing complex projects, is a plus.
  • Intermediate level Excel skills, with proven ability to develop and generate ad hoc reports is essential
  • Strong knowledge of payroll protocols, tax and labor laws.
  • Experience in EMEA/APAC Payroll desired.
  • Ability to maintain data confidentiality with a strong sense of professional integrity.
  • Highly analytical with exceptional organization and prioritization skills, and proven ability to meet hard deadlines.
  • Strong commitment to customer service and ability to communicate concisely, both written and verbally.
  • Proactive, flexible, assertive, with a creative approach to problem solving and a key focus on process improvements,].

lists.text: On a daily basis you will:
lists.content:
• Exceed annual sales target
  • Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for each enterprise account, then drive the execution of that plan to success
  • Prospecting, building the pipeline and selling Coupa cloud-based spend management solutions to enterprise Coupa clients
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and quarterback the deal to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
  • Provide pro-active, trusted thought leadership to target accounts
  • Co-sell with Resellers and Alliance Partners as needed
  • Orchestrate internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that Coupa will deliver and the investments the client will need to make
  • Build and complete Field Sales Campaigns to create demand
  • Develop and deliver premier Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Implement our Coupa Sales Best Practices
  • Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%)
  • Maintain the system of record in Salesforce.com
  • Develop and deliver extraordinary Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and drive deals to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale.
  • Align overall value messaging targeted towards the chief economic buyer in target accounts
  • Build out an account penetration model that encourages multi-angle access into key accounts.

• Strong and demonstrable direct enterprise-level sales experience in the software industry, particularly within the Finance or Banking industries in Thailand
  • Proficiency in Thai and English language
  • The eligible candidate should demonstrate a successful career with extensive direct sales and business development experience in the Region and should be able to provide direct references in the Asia Region, preferably Thailand who can attest to the acclaimed experience.
  • Consistent track record of achieving/exceeding sales quota (SaaS)
  • Strong executive presence – very comfortable with C-level executives, especially CFOs
  • Expertise in handling multi-stakeholder sales cycles and closing large deals
  • Ability to prospect within greenfield accounts
  • Organised and specific experience with enterprise account planning
  • Focused on selling business value to Finance and Business stakeholders using ROI and TCO models, rather than challenging on “features & functions”.
  • Ability to identify enterprise client pains and develop unique and compelling value propositions that focus on delivering business value to the client
  • Equally successful at engaging with all levels in an organisation (bottom-up & top-down)
  • Bold, Passionate, Consultative, loves to challenge and win!
  • Phenomenal at building relationships and working within a team selling environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with selling SaaS solutions
  • Spend management domain expertise desired
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced and passionate environment
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required.


    • #LI-REMOTE

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

lists.content:
• Exceed annual sales targets
  • Develop an Enterprise Account Plan for each enterprise account, then drive the execution of that plan to success
  • Prospecting, building pipeline and selling Coupa cloud-based spend management solutions to enterprise Coupa clients
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and quarterback the deal to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
  • Provide proactive, trusted thought leadership to target accounts
  • Co-sell with Resellers and Alliance Partners as needed (Resellers and Partners are acquired and managed by the Coupa Alliances team out of Coupa headquarters in San Mateo, CA, and in locations around the globe)
  • Orchestrate client and internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that Coupa will deliver and the investments the client will need to make
  • Create and execute Field Sales Campaigns to create demand
  • Develop and deliver world-class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Implement our Coupa Sales Best Practices
  • Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%)
  • Maintain the system of record in Salesforce.com
  • Develop and deliver world class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and drive deals to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model (http://www.executiveboard.com/exbd-resources/content/challenger/index.html)
  • Align overall value messaging targeted towards the chief economic buyer in target accounts
  • Build out an account penetration model that encourages multi-angle access into key accounts

• Minimum 10+ years of direct sales experience in the software industry
  • The eligible candidate should be able to demonstrate a successful career with extensive direct sales and business development experience in the region, and should be able to provide direct references in the Region who can attest to the acclaimed experience
  • Consistent track record of achieving / exceeding sales quota (on premise and SaaS)
  • Strong executive presence – very comfortable with C-level executives, especially CFOs
  • Expertise in managing multi-stakeholder sales cycles and closing large deals
  • Ability to prospect within greenfield accounts
  • Organized and specific experience with enterprise account planning
  • Focused on selling business value to Finance and Business stakeholders using ROI and TCO models, rather than competing on “features & functions”
  • Ability to identify enterprise client pains and develop unique and compelling value propositions that focus on delivering business value to the client
  • Equally successful at engaging with all levels in an organization (bottom up & top down)
  • Assertive, Passionate, Consultative, loves to compete and win
  • Great at building relationships and working within a team-selling environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with selling SaaS solutions
  • Spend management domain expertise desired
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced and passionate environment
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience required

lists.content:
• Exceed annual sales targets
  • Create and develop Strategic Account Plans for each assigned account, then drive the execution of that plan to success. This critical process provides the basis for account discovery, understanding, and strategy development as well as educating and informing the extended Coupa sales/support groups who will be part of the pursuit teams.
  • Prospecting, building the pipeline and selling Coupa cloud-based spend management solutions to assigned Coupa clients from an Enterprise platform perspective.
  • Engage with C-level prospects to position Coupa’s enterprise value proposition and quarterback the deal to closure
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
  • Provide proactive, trusted thought leadership to target accounts
  • Co-sell with Alliance Partners as needed
  • Orchestrate internal teams to collaboratively build Joint Vision Roadmaps outlining the value that Coupa will deliver and the investments the client will need to make
  • Create and execute Field Sales Campaigns to create demand
  • Develop and deliver world-class Executive Sales proposals to C-level prospects
  • Implement our Coupa Sales Best Practices
  • Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%)
  • Fully maintain all account activity in the company’s CRM system of record (Salesforce.com)
  • Adopt the concept of Business Value Selling within the context of the Challenger Sale model
  • Align overall value messaging targeted towards the chief economic buyer in target accounts
  • Build out an account penetration model that encourages multi-angle access into key accounts

• Strong and referenceable direct sales experience and track record in the software industry
  • The eligible candidate should be able to demonstrate a successful career with extensive direct sales and business development experience and provide direct references in the who can attest to the acclaimed experience
  • Consistent track record of achieving/exceeding sales quota (SaaS) (provide last 5 years sales targets and achievement)
  • Strong executive presence – very comfortable with C-level executives, especially CPO, CIO, and CFO personas.
  • Expertise in managing multi-stakeholder sales cycles and closing large deals (will be asked to provide detailed relevant examples)
  • Ability to prospect within greenfield accounts
  • Organized and specific experience with enterprise account planning
  • Strong proficiency and adsorption of modern sales approaches (Challenger, Value Selling) as well as leverage modern sales technology (LinkedIn, Salesforce, Consensus, Zoom Info, Google Suite..)
  • Focused on selling business value to Finance and Business stakeholders using ROI and TCO models, rather than competing on “features & functions”
  • Ability to identify enterprise client pains and develop unique and compelling value propositions that focus on delivering business value to the client
  • Equally successful at engaging with all levels in an organization (bottom up & top down)
  • Assertive, Passionate, Consultative, loves to compete and win
  • Great at building relationships and working within a team-selling environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience with selling SaaS solutions
  • Spend management domain expertise desired
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced and passionate environment
  • Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience required

descriptionPlain:
Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

The opportunity
As a Senior Frontend Software Engineer, you will play an important role in the development of solutions for our Treasury platform.

Treasury in a nutshell: To spend you need to make a payment. To make a payment you need to have enough cash at the right time, in the right account, and in the right currency. Treasury is part of Coupa Pay, a fast-growing part of the Coupa solution.
At a business level, together with product management you will change the way our customers deal with financial challenges like having a reliable overview across all banks & accounts in one place, plan future financial needs and reconcile these with reality.

At a technical level we will jointly drive scaling our Business Spend Management platform as we expand and find the right balance between the power of a consolidated codebase and the flexibility of microservices. You will build maintainable, extendable & performant software that scales across our customer base and equally important our engineering community. This gives you the opportunity to collaborate across products with engineers all over the company to shape central components used by many teams.

In more detail:
- We mainly work on a TypeScript / React frontend in combination with a .Net 6 backend
- We operate as SaaS solution on AWS
- We follow design principles such as functional components and use modern frameworks like react query or react testing library
- We utilize modern CI/CD pipeline, featuring Kubernetes, Jenkins and Octopus
- We apply peer reviews and pair programming
- We follow a typical release cycle where you will drive feature design, participate and guide implementation and take responsibility for delivery to the customer

At Coupa we also practice a culture of sharing, you will have various opportunities to share your ideas and hear from other teams how they solve their technical challenges. For example we regularly organize hack days in which we explore new ideas & technologies.

We are thrilled to see your ideas become reality in our products and processes.
To get more first hand impressions please check out the stories of Coupa employees in our Humans of Coupa section.

About you
We are looking for a dedicated and passionate Software Engineer, with strong contributions in current and past roles. We need someone with:
- Proficient in a modern frontend framework
- Knowledge of web technologies, best practices and standards
- Critical thinking, continuously challenging how and why we do things to help us improve
- Excellent English communication skills both verbal and in writing.
- Willingness to live our values: Ensure Customer Success, Focus on Results and Strive for Excellence
- Typical team members have a higher education degree in a STEM area. This is however not a hard requirement.

What can you expect when you join Coupa
- During your onboarding you will:
- Have a buddy that will guide you on your onboarding journey
- Receive training on our products, processes and organization
- Learn our stack by diving into pair programming with the team

Once you are fully onboarded you will:
- Drive feature design and implementation in your team
- Participate in our community to evolve together
- Pursue your personal development journey as part of the Coupa family

Location
Coupa has a modern office in Karlsruhe, just a short walk from the Karlsruhe-Durlach station, as well as an office in Ettenheim in the heart of the black forest. You can decide which office you would like to work from. 
Our flexible policy enables you to work from home according to your and your team's needs.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

The opportunity
We at Coupa leverage a diverse set of technologies to achieve our business goals.
In the treasury space our teams mainly leverage the .NET core framework and typescript & react to implement complex business requirements and keep our application state-of-the-art. We work closely with our product managers to speak the same language, not only in speech but also in code. 

We strive to deliver excellent cloud applications to our customers by including modern software engineering best practices into our daily work.

We containerize our modernized stack in a kubernetes cluster to maximize flexibility to our engineers while being able to standardize across our distributed service landscape. We use GitHub, Jenkins and octopus to ensure a streamlined development and delivery of our product, always holding up to our high quality standards.

At Coupa we also practice a culture of sharing, you will have various opportunities to share your ideas and hear from other teams how they solve their technical challenges. 

We are thrilled to see your ideas helping in striving for excellence in our product and processes. To get more first hand impressions please check out the stories of Coupa employees in our Humans of Coupa section.

What can you expect when you join Coupa
During your first month you will:
- get your swag package to celebrate your arrival
- have a warm welcome from colleagues who are always happy to help
- attend sessions that will enable you to get to know our products, organization and processes

During your second month you will:
- be encouraged to give feedback on your Coupa experience so far
- receive the bulk of your role specific training
- get deeply involved with your team to get your hands dirty

In your third month you will:
- create with your supporting manager a development plan that ensures you get, what you need and can go in the direction you want
- continue to learn and work with your team

Once you are fully onboarded you will:
- design and work on features with your team that ensure the success of our customers
- participate in our community to evolve together
- develop yourself according to your individual development plan

What we’re ideally looking for
We don't consider experience with C# as a prerequisite - We are looking for a Software Engineer who has a natural passion for technology and problem solving, and would thrive working in a critical thinking environment. Coupa is a company for people to learn and grow, so if our opportunity sounds of interest and you’d like to make an impact, we would love to hear from you. 

Location
Coupa has a modern office in Karlsruhe, just a short walk from the Karlsruhe-Durlach station, as well as an office in Ettenheim in the heart of the black forest. You can decide which office you would like to work from. 
Our flexible policy enables you to work from home according to your and your team's needs.

descriptionPlain:
Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

The opportunity
We at Coupa leverage a diverse set of technologies to achieve our business goals.
In the treasury space our teams mainly leverage the .NET core framework and typescript & react to implement complex business requirements and keep our application state-of-the-art. We work closely with our product managers to speak the same language, not only in speech but also in code. 

We strive to deliver excellent cloud applications to our customers by including modern software engineering best practices into our daily work.

We containerize our modernized stack in a kubernetes cluster to maximize flexibility to our engineers while being able to standardize across our distributed service landscape. We use GitHub, Jenkins and octopus to ensure a streamlined development and delivery of our product, always holding up to our high quality standards.

At Coupa we also practice a culture of sharing, you will have various opportunities to share your ideas and hear from other teams how they solve their technical challenges. 

We are thrilled to see your ideas helping in striving for excellence in our product and processes. To get more first hand impressions please check out the stories of Coupa employees in our Humans of Coupa section.

What can you expect when you join Coupa
During your first month you will:
- get your swag package to celebrate your arrival
- have a warm welcome from colleagues who are always happy to help
- attend sessions that will enable you to get to know our products, organization and processes

During your second month you will:
- be encouraged to give feedback on your Coupa experience so far
- receive the bulk of your role specific training
- get deeply involved with your team to get your hands dirty

In your third month you will:
- create with your supporting manager a development plan that ensures you get, what you need and can go in the direction you want
- continue to learn and work with your team

Once you are fully onboarded you will:
- design and work on features with your team that ensure the success of our customers
- participate in our community to evolve together
- develop yourself according to your individual development plan

What we’re ideally looking for
We don't consider experience with C# as a prerequisite - We are looking for a Software Engineer who has a natural passion for technology and problem solving, and would thrive working in a critical thinking environment. Coupa is a company for people to learn and grow, so if our opportunity sounds of interest and you’d like to make an impact, we would love to hear from you. 

Location
Coupa has a modern office in Ettenheim in the heart of the black forest. 
Our flexible policy enables you to work from home according to your and your team's needs.

As Senior Product Manager for Coupa’s mobile team, you’ll help define and build products that are valuable, usable and feasible. You sit in the middle of the business community, engineering team and user experience team, and are the voice of the customer. lists.content:
• Drive the vision, roadmap planning and execution of Coupa’s mobile products for iOS and Android, both short-term through the next several months in detail, as well as mapping out the next year or two
  • Collaborate with partners in engineering and UX to design and deliver features that expand what the global Coupa community can do on-the-go with Coupa’s Business Spend Management platform
  • Balance innovation, customer and market needs to deliver delightful, useful and clear experiences
  • Manage the entire product life cycle: strategic planning, roadmap, feature design, development support, go-to-market, and field support
  • Work cross-functionally to ensure alignment between Mobile and the wider Coupa organization
  • Negotiate and advocate with other teams to solve cross-product needs
  • Work with localization, documentation and engineering to support an international market with region-specific regulations and taxes
  • Represent the product internally and externally, with occasional travel and presentations—both internally, and to customers with wide ranging user needs and levels of sophistication.

• You have 3-5 years of Product Management experience in an innovative SaaS/Cloud product company
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
  • You’re a hands-on learner with a history of quickly mastering complex new areas
  • You know your market, customers and competition
  • You understand the importance of UX, and you prioritize and drive toward highly usable, well-designed solutions with clear UX standards
  • You’re biased toward action, a great collaborator, and use analysis and facts to help make decisions
  • You understand the importance of solid engineering, testing, prioritizing the bug backlog, and managing technical debt
  • You balance team, company and external priorities, and make effective and well-reasoned tradeoffs
  • BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a technical degree is preferred; MBA a strong plus. Or equivalent work experience

• Experience in Enterprise SaaS software or with areas of business spend management like sourcing, contracts, procurement, expensing or payments
  • Software product design skills and experience
  • Strong fundamentals with mobile app development, agile software development, Jira, Confluence, iOS, Android and all that bread ‘n’ butter stuff

Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

Experience Level: Senior or Lead level 

Coupa Product Line: Sourcing 

Company Size: approx 3500 globally

Tech Stack Used: Microservices (Golang, Docker, K8s, and AWS), MVC (Ruby on Rails and Resque), Frontend (React and Redux), optimization (mixed-integer programming), logging (Grafana, NewRelic, and ELK), and VCS (Git and Github).

Primary skills we consider: Ruby on Rails, React, Microservices 

Secondary skills we consider: Other OO language experience (C#, Java, Python, Rust)  

Compensation: Basic salary + yearly bonus + initial stock grant (RSU’s) and ongoing refreshes

Remote working: Office based or hybrid model requiring 1-2 days per week in office. 

Office location: Uppsala, Sweden 

Working Timezone: CEST 


The Role
- Build our product together with a highly skilled and educated team that has a culture of striving for excellence, and working closely with our stakeholders to deliver the best results to our customers.
- Come up with innovative solutions to new problems, in an international and diverse organization that celebrates new ways of thinking.
- Work together with colleagues from different departments to solve real-life problems with a real impact for our customers. 
- Build the Coupa’s Sourcing applications, together with our sibling teams, which is the most comprehensive e-sourcing solution in the world.

Responsibilities 
- Write and maintain clean, performant, secure, scalable, and testable code in our Ruby application, or one of our microservices.
- Come up with new technical architectures for new features and present the resulting design documents to the architecture team.
- Help maintain a high degree of code quality for the rest of the team, and Coupa as a whole, through code reviews and team discussions.
- Work with the rest of the engineering team to break-down, estimate, and coordinate infra-feature work.
- Work with the professional services or support teams to troubleshoot and solve customer issues.

About You
- Experience working, and combining, multiple different programming languages. For example Java, Javascript, Python, Ruby, or Golang.
- Experience working in large code bases.
- Experience writing performant, secure, scalable, and testable code.
- Experience working in a highly collaborative environment, using technologies such as Slack, JIRA, and Git to coordinate your work.

Nice to haves
- Experience debugging and troubleshooting distributed systems.
- Experience with microservice development in Golang or Java.
- Experience with frontend development in React.


Company Benefits
- 25 days Paid Time Off (PTO)
- 40 hours Volunteer Time Off (VTO) 
- Pension 
- Medical Insurance 
- Life Insurance
- Business Travel Insurance 
- Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
- Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) 
- Referral Bonus 

Interview Process
1. Recruiter call 
2. Hiring Manager Interview 
3. Tech Interview I with 2 Lead Engineers (hard skills and design & architecture) 
4. Tech Interview II with 1 Lead Engineer (scalability - options and workflow) 
5. Final stage with Senior Director

The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

The opportunity
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will contribute to the development of solutions for our Treasury platform. 

Treasury in a nutshell: To spend you need to make a payment. To make a payment you need to have enough cash at the right time, in the right account, and in the right currency. Treasury is part of Coupa Pay, a fast-growing part of the Coupa solution. 

At a business level, together with product management you will change the way our customers deal with financial challenges like having a reliable overview across all banks & accounts in one place, plan future financial needs and reconciling these with reality.

At a technical level, we will jointly drive scaling our Business Spend Management platform as we expand and find the right balance between the power of a consolidated codebase and the flexibility of microservices. You will support your team in building maintainable, extendable & performant software that scales across our customer base and equally important our engineering community. This gives you the opportunity to collaborate across products with engineers all over the company to shape central components used by many teams. 

In more detail:
- We mainly work on C#, .Net 6 in combination with a TypeScript / React frontend
- We operate as SaaS solution on AWS
- We follow design principles such as SOLID, CQRS and DDD
- We utilize a modern CI/CD pipeline, featuring Kubernetes, Jenkins and Octopus
- We apply peer reviews and pair programming

lists.content:
• Create design deliverables and shape the future of Coupa’s industry leading Supply Chain Design & Planning products
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define feature requirements
  • Work closely with researchers and assist/lead research initiatives for discovery and design direction validation 
  • Rapidly iterate on designs and work with stakeholders to align on feature direction
  • Present designs and supporting research findings to stakeholders
  • Work with developers to ensure designs are feasible and implemented as intended
  • Evaluate and monitor the success rate of previously deployed features  
  • Collaborate with the global UX team regarding best practices, design language, internal tooling and overall process efficiencies

• 5+ years’ overall design experience with 3+ years designing within a complex enterprise domain
  • Strong understanding and real world use of user-centered design practices
  • Enjoys the challenge and has been successful transforming complex requirements into highly useable and delightful interfaces
  • Understanding and experienced utilizing UX research methodologies
  • Can effectively communicate with stakeholders to realize your design vision
  • Experience working in a fast-paced global environment building enterprise products a plus
  • Visual design experience a plus
  • Figma expertise preferred
  • Google Analytics and/or Pendo experience a plus
  • Candidates in close proximity to Ann Arbor, MI preferred, remote opportunities available with preference towards Eastern Standard Time 
  • Portfolio demonstrating previous design projects, candidates without portfolios will not be considered.

Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.

Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

Overview 
As a Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in building our cloud-based, software-as-a-service, application as part of our highly skilled and experienced engineering team. Our Uppsala team has more than 20+ years of experience solving very complex problems in optimization and data processing for our customers. Coupa’s suite of applications is built using a wide range of technologies such as Java, Ruby, Resque, ElasticSearch, SQL, etc, and our team of over 500 SWEs globally are responsible for building new and maintaining existing applications.

Role
At a technical level, you as part of a larger team will own end-to-end development of new features (design, planning, execution, testing, and deployment) using Agile methodology and CI/CD; and when a problem is found you will work with quality engineering and support to find a resolution that ensures success for all parties. You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate across products with engineers all over the company and globe, as well as collaborate with Product and UX to plan and design new products and features.

If you have knowledge of or experience with the areas below you might be the right fit for our Engineering team!  We offer an extensive onboarding experience as well as mentorships and sponsor continuous learning opportunities throughout your career.
- Building web applications using different technologies
- Breaking hard and complex problems into comprehensible parts, and being able to present your solutions to the rest of the team
- Object-oriented or functional programming
- Understanding how to build high quality, testable, maintainable, performant, and scalable code using tools like version control, static / dynamic code analysis, and code review

Why
The culture at Coupa is why!  Coupa is certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values: ensuring customer success with an obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful, focusing on results with a relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and having a bias for action, and striving for excellence with our commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

- Understanding how to build high quality, testable, maintainable, performant, and scalable code using tools like version control, static / dynamic code analysis, and code review

Why
The culture at Coupa is why!  Coupa is certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values: ensuring customer success with an obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful, focusing on results with a relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and having a bias for action, and striving for excellence with our commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

lists.content:
• The Customer Success team is looking for a Director of Technical Services for the Value Shared Services(VSS) org.
  • This newly created role is responsible for building the technical services team in the VSS region with close collaboration with many different participants across Coupa to ensure on time and on target delivery of the program
  • Duties for the Director include a broad range of tasks such as maintaining ongoing customer relationships and networking, implementing successful delivery programs, ensuring team’s utilization.
  • Ability to function as an individual Technical Architect(TA) on customer implementations to ensure the maximum value is derived from our integration services, by quantifying the value, driving adoption, sharing best practices, answering business questions, identifying opportunities.
  • Effectively partner and communicate with customer senior management teams during Coupa implementations to influence the strategies, decisions and impacts.
  • You should also be able to provide insights on client-to-business interactions, improve customer experience through product support, and handle customer requests and complaints.
  • Manage escalations, expectations and work with Coupa / Customer project managers to meet project timeline and quality obligations
  • Manage and mentor newly hired TA’s on the team and Partners to successfully deliver the solution
  • Apply knowledge and standard methodologies to influence & lead strategy and design during customer implementations.
  • Lead Specialized Customer Success at scale initiatives
  • Work well in both individual and team settings both on and off client site

• We need a self-starter who has experience with scale but also understands the value of technical services for delivering customer success.
  • Successful candidates must have exceptional interpersonal skills, possess an aptitude for learning and using new software, and be able to communicate clearly and effectively.
  • 10+ years of overall experience working with integration technologies of customer success orgs in Procurement and/or - - AP Automation space with 3+ years leadership experience.
  • Proven hands-on experience architecting large-scale integrations that involve ERP Integrations with SAP / PeopleSoft / ORACLE E-Business Suite/Netsuite
  • Experience with one or more Finance and Procurement functional areas (e.g. Procure to Order, Procure to Pay, Expenses, Accounts Payable)
  • Hands-on experience with sFTP, RESTful APIs, SOAP APIs, and Single Sign-On configuration
  • Hands-on ERP Integration Domain Knowledge – SAP / PeopleSoft / ORACLE
  • Familiarity with AWS or other cloud host stack
  • Strong multilingual(English & Spanish) written and verbal communication skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • ****ALL RESUMES MUST BE SUBMITTED IN ENGLISH TO BE CONSIDERED

• Proven hands on experience integrating with external supplier systems using standards like EDI, cXML etc
  • Middleware Experience – IBM / TIBCO / SAP PI PO / ORACLE / Boomi
  • Programming Language Experience – Ruby / Java / .NET
  • Proficient with SQL and fundamental relational database concepts
  • Strong experience with Linux servers in virtualized environment
  • Hands-on experience with software development and system administration

• Provide second level of techno-functional support on Coupa enterprise solution (including power apps and acquired products that are assigned to the product vertical) and associated business understanding.
  • Develop an understanding of how our customers do business and what role our products play in that business.
  • Proficiently handles customer issues and escalations for production environments within guidelines across Severity levels.
  • Gathers and records detailed information from customers to assist in problem identification and resolution, exercises independent thinking in trouble-resolution skills.
  • Provide case status and next steps to the customer and management according to Support offerings Service Level Targets.
  • Work with other business units, including the Integration team, Operations, Engineering and Customer Success, as required ensuring strong customer satisfaction.
  • Create and contribute to the development of knowledge articles in Coupa’s knowledgebase.
  • Keep up to date on Training through CoupaU and complete 100% of all required certifications.
  • Read, analyze, and comprehend functional documentation in line with Coupa’s product releases

• Must be a fast learner, self-motivated, and able to work in a fast-paced environment with at-least 5 to 7 years of Enterprise support experience.
  • Possesses excellent written and verbal communication skills at all levels of an organization, internally and externally.
  • Technical background in Linux, Unix and other Operating Systems.
  • Skilled in using XML, HTML and other Web technologies.
  • Ability to read database tables using SQL queries, and log files thus enabling effective troubleshooting and fast resolution of customer issues.
  • Understanding the Procurement domain will be an added advantage.
  • Understanding of Web servers, Application servers and Databases (preferred).
  • Knowledge and understanding of scripts will be an added advantage.
  • Willing to work in a 24x5 environment including On-call support for weekends.

We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:

1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful.
2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action.
3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability.

Coupa Software is a leader in business spend management (BSM). We provide a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. 
Coupa is a fast growing company with headquarters in San Mateo, California with offices throughout Europe, Latin America, and Asia Pacific. Since 2021 Coupa has development sites in Karlsruhe and Ettenheim. You will join the engineering teams and support them in the development of solutions for our Treasury platform. Our SaaS solution on AWS is mainly based on a C#, .Net 6 stack in combination with a TypeScript / React frontend. 
Your tasks may range from developing new functionalities for the platform, implementing new interfaces or micro services, analyzing our machine learning solutions or improving our development pipeline depending on your skills and your interests. 
We are looking for motivated students with experience in an object oriented language (not necessarily C#) and good English communication skills. You should be eager to solve problems and to drive innovations in a team. Working times are between 16 and 20h per week preferably in the office. In our offices we offer free lunch and beverages, team breakfasts, BBQ and other events. We believe that onboarding and deeper discussions are more efficient in the office. Writing your Bachelor or Master thesis after your time as a Working student at Coupa is also conceivable. Please upload your motivation letter which includes why you want to join and what makes you outstanding and your current transcripts. 
Coupa has been named one of Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Technology in 2021 and as part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.
 To get more first hand impressions please check out the stories of Coupa employees in our Humans of Coupa section.
